intro: Argyrolobium monticola, commonly known as the mountain silverhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it is often found in mountainous regions. Argyrolobium monticola is adapted to arid environments and is part of the legume family, Fabaceae.
